intro: Betonica graeca subsp. scardica, commonly known as the Greek betony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces violet-blue flowers in spikes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone areas. Betonica graeca subsp. scardica is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses.
